example.eg: They put a fence around the swimming pool.
example.egtrans: 他们在游泳池周围竖起了栅栏。

example.eg: They sat around the table wondering what to do next.
example.egtrans: 他们围坐在桌子旁，思考接下来要做什么。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 环绕, 在…周围, 围住

example.eg: Put the belt around your waist and then fasten it.
example.egtrans: 把安全带环绕在腰上，然后系紧。

example.eg: She travels around the country for her job.
example.egtrans: 她在全国各地到处出差。

example.eg: There were roads leading off all around the house.
example.egtrans: 有通向那栋房子各个方向的路。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 向四周, 向各个方向

example.eg: Books were spread all around the room.
example.egtrans: 书扔得满屋子都是。

example.eg: I'll see you around three o'clock.
example.egtrans: 我们三点左右见。

example.eg: The dog ran around and around trying to catch its tail.
example.egtrans: 这条狗转着圈跑来跑去，想抓住自己的尾巴。

example.eg: The guard entered the square and glanced around to see if any enemies were near.
example.egtrans: 守卫走上广场，四处查看，了解附近是否有敌人。

example.eg: The earth turns around on its axis.
example.egtrans: 地球绕地轴自转。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 环绕着, 围绕着（…转动等）

example.eg: It's around three inches tall and an inch wide.
example.egtrans: 它大约三英寸高，一英寸宽。

example.eg: It takes around 60 gallons of water to grow one avocado.
example.egtrans: 种植一株鳄梨需要大约60加仑的水。

example.eg: Plastic chairs have been around for thirty years.
Is she around? I want to ask her something.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 在附近的, 在左右的

example.eg: It's a beautiful house with trees all around.
example.egtrans: 这栋房子很漂亮，四周都是树。

example.eg: The vase is ten centimetres around.
example.egtrans: 这个花瓶周长为十厘米。

example.eg: There are lots of shops around.
example.egtrans: 这周围有很多商店。

example.eg: There are rumours going around.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 到处, 四处, 在各处

example.eg: The road goes around to the orchard.
example.egtrans: 这条路迂回地通往果园。

example.eg: The crowd watched with excitement as the cars raced around.
example.egtrans: 人群激动地看着车子绕着圈子飞驰。

example.eg: She came around to my house.  I drove round to the office to pick up some files.
example.egtrans: 她到我的家来了。我开车去办公司拿些文件。

example.eg: Is James around the office somewhere?
example.egtrans: 詹姆斯在办公室附近什么地方吗？

example.eg: We should go around town and put posters up.
example.egtrans: 我们应该去到城镇的各处张贴海报。

example.eg: The course is organized around important historical events.
example.egtrans: 该课程是围绕重要的历史事件所组织的。

example.eg: There were about fifteen people in our tour group.
example.egtrans: 我们的旅行团大约有15个人。

dsense.name: about
dsense.guideword: (time: close to, more or less) (时间)

example.eg: I heard a crash at about ten o'clock last night.
example.egtrans: 我昨晚10点左右听到一声巨响。

example.eg: I went to the library to look for a book about insects.
example.egtrans: 我去图书馆找一本关于昆虫的书。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 涉及, 讲的是, 关于，有关

example.eg: My presentation is about the effects of alcohol.  This book is about a king who loses his crown.
example.egtrans: 我的报告内容是关于酒精影响的。这本书讲述的是一名国王丢掉皇位的故事。

example.eg: What do you think about the president's speech?
example.egtrans: 你对总统的演说有什么看法？

example.eg: She was sitting at her desk, books lying all about.
example.egtrans: 她坐在书桌边，周围都摆满了书。

dsense.name: about
dsense.guideword: mainly UK (from one spot to another)

example.eg: He was dancing about, waving his lottery ticket in the air.
example.egtrans: 他挥舞着彩票，轻快地跳来跳去。

example.eg: I was just about to step into the bath when the doorbell rang.
example.egtrans: 我正要进入浴室时，门铃响了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 正要做…的时候，正准备做…时

example.eg: He whirled about and saw that his girlfriend was behind him.
example.egtrans: 他转过身，发现他女朋友已在他身后。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 掉头，掉转方向，往反方向

example.eg: The lake is approximately three miles about.
There are lots of cases of the measles about.
There's something about his voice that makes me nervous.
example.egtrans: 他的声音有种让我紧张的特性。

example.eg: There were shots all about us.
example.egtrans: 我们周围全是镜头。

example.eg: There are lots of trees about the house and garden.
Not many people are about today.
example.egtrans: 今天在这里的人不多。

dsense.name: arse about, arse around
dsense.guideword: UK, vulgar, slang (behave in a frivolous way)

dsense.name: bandy [sth] about, bandy about [sth], bandy [sth] around, bandy around [sth]

trans_examp.trans_cn: 将…丢来丢去, 来回投掷

dsense.name: bang around, also UK: bang about

example.eg: The baby woke up in the middle of the night, crying, because Joe was banging around in the kitchen.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 乒乒乓乓地搬动东西, 笨手笨脚地发出声响

dsense.name: bat [sth] around, also UK: bat [sth] about

trans_examp.trans_cn: 随便谈论, 非正式地讨论

example.eg: My manager likes to boss people around.
Over the holidays, I just bummed around and watched TV.
example.egtrans: 整个假期，我都是无所事事，看看电视。

example.eg: He's always buzzing around doing chores.
Wives don't want their husbands to cat around with other women.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 寻欢问柳, 拈花惹草

dsense.name: clown around, also UK: clown about
dsense.guideword: informal (play the fool, behave in a silly way)

example.eg: One can never take him seriously; he's always clowning around.

dsense.name: come around, also UK: come round

example.eg: The patient came around soon after his operation.
example.egtrans: 手术过后没多久，病人就苏醒了。

dsense.name: come around, also UK: come round

example.eg: My parents aren't keen on my new boyfriend, but they'll come round when they get to know him.
example.egtrans: 我的父母不喜欢我的新男友，但当他们了解了他之后，他们就会改变看法的。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 改变观点，改变看法, 被说服

dsense.name: come around, also UK: come round to [sth]

example.eg: Steve eventually came round to my opinion.
example.egtrans: 最终，史蒂夫改而接受我的观点了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 改变观点, 改而接受…的观点

dsense.name: come around, also UK: come round

example.eg: Jill always feels sad when the anniversary of her husband's death comes around.
example.egtrans: 每到丈夫的忌日，吉尔就会陷入悲痛之中。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 再次到来, 再次发生

example.eg: The teenager spent the afternoon diddling around with his phone.
example.egtrans: 这位少年花费了一个下午的时间在摆弄手机。

example.eg: She didn't feel like doing anything, so she just dragged around all day.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 慢腾腾地走动, 缓慢地行动

dsense.name: drop around, also UK: drop round

example.eg: Steve dropped round earlier, while you were out; I said you'd phone him when you got back.
example.egtrans: 你早先出门的时候，史蒂夫来串门了；我告诉他你回来就会给他打电话。

dsense.name: drop around, also UK: drop [sth] round

example.eg: As you'll be passing my house anyway, could you drop that paperwork around?
example.egtrans: 反正你要经过我家，能不能顺便把那份文件带来？

dsense.name: fart around, also UK: fart about
fiddle around, also UK: fiddle about

example.eg: He began to fiddle around doing crossword puzzles, but soon noticed his English was improving.

dsense.name: fiddle around with [sth], also UK: fiddle about with [sth]

example.eg: She fiddled around with the things on her desk while I was talking.

dsense.name: fiddle around with [sth], also UK: fiddle about with [sth]

example.eg: He loved to fiddle about with old cars, but never actually fixed them up.

dsense.name: flail around, also UK: flail about

trans_examp.trans_cn: 剧烈扭动，猛烈摆动，拼命乱挥

example.eg: He followed me around all day.
The teacher told Bobby to stop fooling around in class.
example.egtrans: 老师叫博比不要在课堂上吊儿郎当。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 吊儿郎当, 傻了吧唧，胡闹

example.eg: The boss doesn't like people fooling around when they should be working.
example.egtrans: 当应该工作的时候，老板不喜欢员工游手好闲。

example.eg: Helen suspects that her husband has been fooling around.
example.egtrans: 海伦怀疑自己的丈夫一直在外乱搞男女关系。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 胡搞, 乱来, 乱搞男女关系

example.eg: He had fooled around with every girl in town before he met Helen.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 与…胡搞, 与…乱搞男女关系

example.eg: Ben spent the afternoon fooling around with his new camera.

dsense.name: f*** around, also UK: f*** about

example.eg: Stop f***ing about and get on with your work!

dsense.name: f*** around
dsense.guideword: vulgar, offensive, slang (have casual sex) (指随意发生性行为)

example.eg: Stan was devastated when he discovered his girlfriend had been f***ing around behind his back.
He's fumbling around in the kitchen; can't you hear the noise?

trans_examp.trans_cn: 瞎摸, 乱动, 胡乱摸索

example.eg: We decided to gad around town for a while.
example.egtrans: 我们决定在城里闲逛一阵。

example.eg: Gather round everybody!  Richard has something to say!
I certainly get around in my job. This year, I've travelled to Korea, Australia and South Africa.
example.egtrans: 我的工作需要四处奔波。今年，我去了韩国、澳大利亚和南非。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 到处旅游, 四处游览

example.eg: His arthritis makes it difficult for him to get around.
example.egtrans: 关节炎使他行动不便。

dsense.name: get around [sth], also UK: get round [sth]

example.eg: You can't get around the problem by pretending it doesn't exist.
example.egtrans: 你不能假装没有问题来回避。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 绕道而行, 绕开, 规避

dsense.name: get around, also UK: get round, get about

example.eg: When word got around that she was baking cookies, all the children appeared at her door.
example.egtrans: 她在烘焙饼干的消息传开后，所有孩子都出现在她门口。

dsense.name: get around to [sth], also UK: get round to [sth]

example.eg: Bill eventually got round to the washing-up.

dsense.name: get around to doing [sth], also UK: get round to doing [sth]

example.eg: One of these days, I will get around to making the trip to Paris.

dsense.name: go around, also UK: go round

example.eg: The baby watched the top go round and laughed.  Each of the beautifully painted horses became visible as the carousel went around.
example.egtrans: 宝宝看着陀螺旋转，呵呵地笑。随着木马开始旋转，一匹匹精致绘制的木马都变得清晰可见。

dsense.name: go around, also UK: go round

example.eg: Do you think there'll be enough loaves and fishes to go around?
example.egtrans: 你认为有足够的面包和鱼给大家分么？

trans_examp.trans_cn: 够分, 分给所有人, 每个人都能分到

dsense.name: go around, also UK: go round, go about

example.eg: There's a nasty strain of flu going around.
example.egtrans: 有一种恶性流感正在肆虐。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 传染，传播, 流行，肆虐

dsense.name: go around, also UK: go round, go about

example.eg: He goes around looking filthy.  She goes about as if she owns the place.
example.egtrans: 他一直都邋里邋遢的。她举止大摇大摆，神气活现，好像这里是她家似得。

dsense.name: go around, also UK: go round, go about

example.eg: There's a rumour going round that you're cheating on Tim.
example.egtrans: 有谣言说你背着提姆在外面寻花问柳。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 传播，流传，四起, 散布

dsense.name: go around, also UK: go round

example.eg: I'll go round to your place when I'm done.
example.egtrans: 我完工后会去你那儿的。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 顺便拜访, 顺便走访

dsense.name: goof around
dsense.guideword: US, slang (behave in a silly way)

example.eg: If you're done goofing around, maybe we could get some work done?

dsense.name: hang around, also UK: hang about

example.eg: It's annoying when youths hang around at the bus stop intimidating customers.
example.egtrans: 年轻人在公车站晃悠恐吓顾客，令人厌烦。

dsense.name: hang around, also UK: hang about

example.eg: I hung around for 30 minutes but Steve didn't show up.
example.egtrans: 我在那里等了30分钟，但史蒂夫却没有出现。

dsense.name: hang around with [sb], also UK: hang about with [sb]

example.eg: Since Harvey started hanging around with a group of older boys, he is always getting in trouble.
example.egtrans: 自从哈维开始和一群大龄男孩混在一起，他总是惹麻烦。

example.eg: We will leave our luggage at the hotel, as we don't want to have to haul it around with us all day.

dsense.name: a millstone around your neck (US), a millstone round your neck (UK)

trans_examp.trans_cn: 如同套在脖子上的磨盘, 成为沉重负担

example.eg: Prices have increased all around.
example.egtrans: 各个地方物价都上涨了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 各个方面, 各个地方

example.eg: Joe called for drinks all around to celebrate his good news.
example.egtrans: 乔打电话给所有人来庆祝他的好消息。

example.eg: This is a better solution all round.
example.egtrans: 从各个方面看，这都是一个更好的解决方案。

example.eg: David looked all around him, but Eleanor was nowhere to be seen.
example.egtrans: 大卫环顾四周都未看到埃莉诺。

example.eg: Joe has developed into an all-around player for the basketball team.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 多才多艺的, 全能的

example.eg: The school aims to provide an all-around education for its students.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 全面的, 各个方面的

example.eg: There were around fifty different tables at the job fair.
The engineers are working around the clock to get the project finished on time.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 不分日夜, 日以继夜

example.eg: His mother is very sick and needs around-the-clock care.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 连续不停地, 日夜不断地

example.eg: It's best to be prepared because you never know what's around the corner.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 在不久的将来, 在近期

example.eg: A new bakery opened recently around the corner.
The Internet allows people around the world to share information.
example.egtrans: 互联网让全球的人们共享信息。

example.eg: Ferdinand Magellan's ship sailed around the world in the 1500s.
example.egtrans: 费迪南德·麦哲伦的船在十六世纪完成了环球航行。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 四处打听, 四处询问

example.eg: The heavy suitcase was lugged around the airport by my mother.

dsense.name: beat around the bush, also UK: beat about the bush

example.eg: Stop beating around the bush and give me the real reason!

dsense.name: beating around the bush, beating about the bush

example.eg: All this beating around the bush is starting to annoy me; just say yes or no!

trans_examp.trans_cn: 旁敲侧击，拐弯抹角，绕圈子

example.eg: I don't like it when bees buzz around my head.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 嗡嗡地在...周围飞来飞去

example.eg: She buzzed around the office, completing task after task.

dsense.name: center on [sth] (US), center around [sth], centre on [sth], centre around [sth] (UK)

trans_examp.trans_cn: 聚焦, 集中精力于, 注重
围绕, 以...为中心, 包围

dsense.name: change [sth] around, change around [sth] (US), change [sth] round, change [sth] round (UK)

example.eg: You can change around the icons on your computer to make them more convenient.
The change around in the team's coaching has helped them win many more games this year.
Mike's mom chauffeured him around to all of his activities..
During story time, the students clustered around their teacher and listened intently.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 紧紧环绕着，聚集在…周围

dsense.name: come around, also UK: come round

example.eg: If you come round later, we can do our homework together.
example.egtrans: 如果你晚点来我家，我们可以一起做作业。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 短暂访问, 顺便拜访

example.eg: Dab the pieces of butter around the top of the pie.
He got fired because d***ing around was his only real skill.
The runner dodged around the people in his path.
Jim ferreted around in the records.
The lawyer ferreted around for any evidence that the police might have missed.

dsense.name: get around doing [sth], also UK: get round doing [sth]

example.eg: The politician got around answering the question by changing the subject.
example.egtrans: 那个政客换了话题来回避回答这个问题。//这个商人钻法律的空子以规避税务。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 规避, 逃避, 避开

dsense.name: get round to [sth], get around to [sth]

example.eg: I didn't get round to any of the tasks on my to-do list today.
example.egtrans: 我今天无法抽出时间来做我待办事项清单上的任何事情。

dsense.name: get round to doing [sth], get around to doing [sth]

example.eg: This wall is so grubby; I must get round to repainting it.
example.egtrans: 这面墙真脏。我必须抽时间将它重新粉刷一下。

dsense.name: get your head around [sth], get your head round [sth]

example.eg: I'm trying to get my head around the subjunctive, but I'm still not sure when to use it.

dsense.name: go around [sth], also UK: go round [sth]

example.eg: I had grown so fat that none of my belts would go around my waist.
example.egtrans: 我长得太胖了，所有的皮带都小了，系不上腰。

dsense.name: go around [sth], also UK: go round [sth]

example.eg: The radio advised of heavy traffic downtown, so we went around the city instead.
example.egtrans: 广播提示说市中心交通拥堵，所以我们转而绕开了城镇。
